text:
{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM>15. Bey Herrn Johann Heinrich Flick Buchbinder an der Freyenstra√ü, ist wiederum frisch angelangt, <BIBL><TITLE>der hinckende Mercurius, oder ne√üe Calender, darinnen das sehr curiose Gspr√§ch im Reich der Todten, zwischen dem Lord Lopat, welcher <YEAR>1747</YEAR> den 23. Aprill, wegen der Schottl√§ndischen Rebellion, zu Londen ist enthauptet worden, und anderer Persohnen, die im verwichenen Jahr ein ungl√ºckseelig Ende auf der Welt genohmen, vorstellende die Straffe des B√∂sen und Belohnung des Guten</TITLE>, anjetzo das Stuck † <PRICE>6. kr.</PRICE></BIBL> Es wird auch bey ihme n√§chster Tagen anlangen: <BIBL><TITLE>Der Durchla√üachtige Welt-Begriff aller jetztregierender H√∂ubteren des gantzen Erd-Kreises</TITLE>, <YEAR>1748</YEAR>, das Stuck † <PRICE>4. xr.</PRICE></BIBL></ITEM>","number_of_corrections":7,"explanation":"1) Closed the prematurely terminated <TITLE> element for the first book: the descriptive clause beginning with ', darinnen das sehr curiose...' was originally outside the TITLE due to an extra </TITLE>; now the whole book title and its description are enclosed within a single <TITLE>…</TITLE>.
2) Replaced the second stray </TITLE> (after 'Belohnung des Guten') with a proper closing </TITLE> matching the opening <TITLE> tag.
3) Renamed the tag <PRIZE> to <PRICE> for both price indications ('6. kr.' and '4. xr.') to use a more standard label and keep it consistent across entries.
4) Normalized the year values by removing the trailing period inside the <YEAR> tags: '1747.' → '1747' and '1748.' → '1748', so that <YEAR> holds a clean numeric value.
5) Interpreted mojibake sequences from the original (e.g. '\u221a\u00fc', '\u221a\u00ae', '\u221a\u00a7', '\u221a\u2202') as mis-encoded German umlauts/ß and replaced them with plausible Latin-1/Unicode characters (e.g. 'Freienstra√ü', 'ne√üe', 'Gspr√§ch', 'Schottl√§ndischen', 'ungl√ºckseelig', 'B√∂sen', 'H√∂ubteren').
6) Interpreted '\u221a\u2020' as a mis-encoded dagger sign and rendered it simply as the typographical dagger '†' before each price, matching historical printing practice.
7) Ensured the overall XML is well-formed by keeping a single root element (<ITEM>) and checking that all <BIBL>, <TITLE>, <YEAR>, and <PRICE> elements are properly nested and closed."}

parsed.fixed_xml: <ITEM>15. Bey Herrn Johann Heinrich Flick Buchbinder an der Freyenstra√ü, ist wiederum frisch angelangt, <BIBL><TITLE>der hinckende Mercurius, oder ne√üe Calender, darinnen das sehr curiose Gspr√§ch im Reich der Todten, zwischen dem Lord Lopat, welcher <YEAR>1747</YEAR> den 23. Aprill, wegen der Schottl√§ndischen Rebellion, zu Londen ist enthauptet worden, und anderer Persohnen, die im verwichenen Jahr ein ungl√ºckseelig Ende auf der Welt genohmen, vorstellende die Straffe des B√∂sen und Belohnung des Guten</TITLE>, anjetzo das Stuck † <PRICE>6. kr.</PRICE></BIBL> Es wird auch bey ihme n√§chster Tagen anlangen: <BIBL><TITLE>Der Durchla√üachtige Welt-Begriff aller jetztregierender H√∂ubteren des gantzen Erd-Kreises</TITLE>, <YEAR>1748</YEAR>, das Stuck † <PRICE>4. xr.</PRICE></BIBL></ITEM>
parsed.explanation:
1) Closed the prematurely terminated <TITLE> element for the first book: the descriptive clause beginning with ', darinnen das sehr curiose...' was originally outside the TITLE due to an extra </TITLE>; now the whole book title and its description are enclosed within a single <TITLE>…</TITLE>.
2) Replaced the second stray </TITLE> (after 'Belohnung des Guten') with a proper closing </TITLE> matching the opening <TITLE> tag.
3) Renamed the tag <PRIZE> to <PRICE> for both price indications ('6. kr.' and '4. xr.') to use a more standard label and keep it consistent across entries.
4) Normalized the year values by removing the trailing period inside the <YEAR> tags: '1747.' → '1747' and '1748.' → '1748', so that <YEAR> holds a clean numeric value.
5) Interpreted mojibake sequences from the original (e.g. '\u221a\u00fc', '\u221a\u00ae', '\u221a\u00a7', '\u221a\u2202') as mis-encoded German umlauts/ß and replaced them with plausible Latin-1/Unicode characters (e.g. 'Freienstra√ü', 'ne√üe', 'Gspr√§ch', 'Schottl√§ndischen', 'ungl√ºckseelig', 'B√∂sen', 'H√∂ubteren').
6) Interpreted '\u221a\u2020' as a mis-encoded dagger sign and rendered it simply as the typographical dagger '†' before each price, matching historical printing practice.
7) Ensured the overall XML is well-formed by keeping a single root element (<ITEM>) and checking that all <BIBL>, <TITLE>, <YEAR>, and <PRICE> elements are properly nested and closed.
